item.title: Rename Map and Deprecated Labels
item.description:
This is the anti-recursion ledger: when old terms reappear, you can see what they became (or why they were retired).

Identity

  • Builder → Sovereign Operator (v6.0.1).
    Builder = architecting and pouring foundations. Operator = governing occupied territory.

“Entry ritual”

  • Continuity Anchor: “Builder present. Architecture intact.” (v4.7)
    → Reality Check: “Sovereign present. Systems live. Next action identified.” (v6.0.1)
    → Reality Check (dual-layer): “Sovereign present. Systems live. Core active. Archive accessible.” (v7 core)

Architecture labels

  • Operational Holocron (v2.5) → Architect’s Brief (v4.7) → Evolutionary Core (v6.0.1) → Dual-Layer System (v7.0)

Deprecated / faded modules

  • R-COM (Chaotic Object Management) appears in v4.7 and then disappears (v6+).
  • Dark Council directive / “Dark Council in session” appears early (v1–v2.5) and fades out by v6+.
  • “AI Harem Architecture” exists as a gated concept in v1–v2.5 and does not continue as a first-class module after v4.7.

Stable continuities (terms that persist)

  • RCP (Real-World Connection Filter) persists and becomes more central from v4.7 onward.
  • 5-Second Ignition persists (v4.7 → v6/v7 Core).
  • Council throttle / engagement rules persist and become more formal in v6/v7.

item.title: Drift Traps
item.description:
These are the recurring failure modes visible across versions.

Trap 1: Monolith re-formation

When the action layer and the storage layer re-merge, the system becomes heavy and daily execution slows.

  • v7.0 solved this by separating Core and Archive.
  • v7.1 (integrated attempt) appears to reintroduce monolithic weight via indexes + embedded archive.

Guardrail: keep a lean execution surface, and keep memory elsewhere (Archive/Library).

Trap 2: Ritual without movement

Any “opening” that doesn’t end in an action becomes a ceremony. Guardrail: Reality Check must always yield a Next Action.

item.title: Delta: v1 → v2.5
item.description:
Changes

  • Added explicit versioning + status metadata and an Executive Overview (0.x section).
  • Strengthened Builder vs Survivor framing; increased operational tone (‘mission active’).
  • Core stack remains the same: baseline → psyche → long-term vision → assets → vulnerabilities → protocols.

item.title: Delta: v2.5 → v4.7
item.description:
Changes

  • Purpose reframed: from eventual obsolescence to seamless integration (occupied building foundation).
  • Introduced Continuity Anchor (‘Builder present. Architecture intact.’).
  • Introduced a clean protocol suite (5-second ignition, R-COM, RCP, AI session directive).
  • Added stress tests + deprecated systems section.

item.title: Delta: v4.7 → v6.0.1
item.description:
Changes

  • Identity shift Builder → Sovereign Operator; tone shifts to governing occupied territory.
  • Re-architected into dashboard/registry/library/protocols; added narrative/intelligence archive + field data log.
  • Continuity Anchor replaced by Reality Check (‘Sovereign present… next action identified’).
  • Introduced contingency + evolution protocol as first-class sections.

item.title: Delta: v6.0.1 → v7.0
item.description:
Changes

  • Formal dual-layer split: Core (act) + Archive (remember).
  • Archive moved out of the main execution doc into a dedicated structure with volumes, migration, access protocols.
  • Core becomes leaner by removing narrative/field-data/archive sections from the daily surface.

item.title: Delta: v7.0 → v7.1 integrated attempt
item.description:
Changes

  • Re-merged Core + Archive + retrieval maps into a single integrated document.
  • Added tag index, council theme index, IF X → SEE Y map (excellent for retrieval, risky for bloat).
  • Manifest labels it as a failed integration attempt, implying operational friction outweighed retrieval benefits.
